snippet: Along with the fine, the Federal Aviation Administration ordered the Port Authority to create cadres of aircraft rescue and firefighting officers, to work independently of its Police Department.
abstract: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, operator of the major airports in the New York metropolitan region, agrees to pay $3.5 million for failing to train its police officers to perform rescues and fight fires under a settlement agreement announced by the Federal Aviation Administration.
lead_paragraph: Along with the fine, the Federal Aviation Administration ordered the Port Authority to create cadres of aircraft rescue and firefighting officers, to work independently of its Police Department.
